The Consumer Technology Association Announces CES 2024 Innovation Awards Honorees
The Consumer Technology Association (CTA)® today announced itsâ€¯CES® 2024 Innovation Awards honorees – including 36 products recognized as the year’s ‘Best of Innovation.’ The CES Innovation Awards is an annual competition honoring outstanding design and engineering in consumer technology products across 29 product categories. The program was ALL ON for CES 2024, receiving more than 3000 submissions, a record high and a 40% increase over CES 2023.
Each year, an independent panel of industry expert judges, including members of the media, designers and engineers, reviews and rates submissions based on innovation, functionality, aesthetic, and design. Those rated the highest across all categories receive the Best of Innovation designation.
For the CES 2024 program, the top two categories by number of submissions were ‘digital health’ and ‘sustainability, eco-design & smart energy.’ This trend underscores the rapid pace of innovation in sectors that promise to solve big global challenges and improve human lives – a major theme at the show as CTA partners with the UN Trust Fund for Human Security and World Academy of Art and Science (WAAS) to advance human security. For the first time, the Best of Innovation list for CES 2024 includes a product from the ‘Human Security’ category, introduced at CES 2023.
The CES 2024 Innovation Awards also features a new category – artificial intelligence (AI). The AI category received 7% of all applications, underscoring that innovators are increasingly recognizing the transformative potential of AI in shaping the future of technology. AI will also be pervasive throughout the CES 2024 show floor and conference programming.
The full Best of Innovation list and all 522 Innovation Award honorees will be announced during CES 2024, where many of the products will appear in the Innovation Awards Showcase at CES, located in the Venetian Expo.

ONECOM’s FINTIN V1 Wins Best of Innovation at CES 2024: Transforming Smartphone Text Input for the Visually Impaired
SEOUL, South Korea, November 20, 2023--(BUSINESS WIRE)--FINTIN V1, a smartphone Bluetooth QWERTY communicator for the visually impaired developed by Korean startup ONECOM, won the Best of Innovation award for the most innovative product in the Mobile Devices, Accessories & Apps category, and an Honoree in the Computer Peripherals & Accessories category at CES 2024.
This press release features multimedia. View the full release here: https://www.businesswire.com/news/home/20231120966759/en/
FINTIN V1, developed by ONECOM, received the "Best of Innovation" award at CES 2024 (Graphic: ONECOM Co., Ltd.)
ONECOM's FINTIN V1 features Structured Mini QWERTY technology, which modularizes 36 keys into 6 keys. This technology is the world's first to realize blind typing, which enables keystrokes without checking the position of the keys with the eyes in a Mini QWERTY size that fits in one hand. It also enhances the user experience by using a universal QWERTY arrangement, making it easy for the visually impaired to use 'FINTIN V1' with little practice.
Additional features include dedicated keys for screen readers such as VoiceOver (iOS) and TalkBack (Android), along with haptic feedback, enabling visually impaired users to access the full range of smartphone functions without the need for manual operation.
Visually impaired people face many challenges in the smartphone era, dominated by touch interfaces that require visual confirmation. On-screen keyboards cannot accurately distinguish keys by touch, requiring more effort to input text.
With FINTIN V1, ONECOM has removed this barrier, significantly improving access to social digital connectivity for the visually impaired.
It is ONECOM's vision to realize a world where the world's 285 million visually impaired people can independently socialize with non-disabled people, communicate in real-time, educate, interact, work, live their daily lives, and create content.
The Structured Mini QWERTY technology used in the FINTIN V1 is set to be implemented not only in products designed for the visually impaired but also in a wide range of text input devices. This includes console game controllers, smart TV remote controllers, and controllers for Metaverse/XR headsets, enhancing compatibility and user experience across various platforms.
ONECOM's award-winning products, recognized for their innovation at CES, will be showcased at CES 2024 in Las Vegas on January 9, 2024, at the KOTRA Korea Pavilion in Eureka Park. Among the exhibits will be the FINTIN XPANDER, an innovative solution designed to facilitate rapid text input across various gaming and smart devices.

ONECOM's FINTIN V1 Mini-QWERTY Communicator for the Visually Impaired to Debut at CES 2024 After Winning Best of Innovation Award
News provided by
02 Jan, 2024, 08:30 ET
Share this article
Share this article
LAS VEGAS and SEOUL, South Korea, Jan. 2, 2024 /PRNewswire/ -- ONECOM will unveil its award-winning FINTIN V1, a handheld mini-QWERTY communicator designed for the visually impaired, at CES 2024 beginning on January 9. The device earned the prestigious CES 2024 Best of Innovation award.
The first of its kind globally, the FINTIN V1 adopts Structured Mini QWERTY technology, enabling blind typing purely through tactile sensations. This eliminates the need for visual key identification in a compact, handheld format.
"With just six keys, this device can process up to 36 different keyboard inputs." The universal QWERTY layout and compact size make it easy for anyone to learn and use. It also has remarkable compatibility with most QWERTY-supported languages.
ONECOM plans to implement Structured Mini QWERTY technology beyond the FINTIN V1, extending it to handheld gaming controllers, XR devices, wearables like the Apple Watch, smart glasses, and smart TV remotes.
At CES 2024, ONECOM will also showcase the FINTIN XPANDER, integrating this technology into the PS5 DualSense controller. This is expected to revolutionize text communication within console gaming by moving beyond on-screen keyboards and voice chat.
The technology will also be adapted for Xbox, Nintendo Switch, and PC controllers, expanding its versatility. Compatible with DualSense-enabled PCs, iPhones, and iPads via Bluetooth, the Fintin Xpander will enhance mobile gaming with quick messaging and chat capabilities.
Through Fintin, ONECOM aims to make real-time communication accessible to all without barriers.
Visit ONECOM at CES 2024 in the Korea Pavilion, Eureka Park, Hall G, 63301_46.
To learn more, visit https://fintin.co.kr. For sales inquiries, please contact [email protected].
PS5 and DualSense are registered trademarks of SONY Corporation.
About ONECOM
ONECOM is an innovator in mobile text input solutions for emerging technologies, including the Metaverse, XR, AR, and VR. Its patented 'Structured Mini Qwerty' technology modularizes a full QWERTY keyboard into just 6 keys for rapid text input in a pocket-sized form factor, helping users quickly develop muscle memory. Utilizing a standard QWERTY layout allows for broad compatibility across languages, including Spanish. ONECOM is developing products applying this technology across devices for the visually impaired, XR headsets and gaming controllers, smart TV remotes, and mobile AI input devices. The company is also actively pursuing third-party IP licensing opportunities.

ONECOM’s FINTIN V1 Wins Innovation Award at CES 2024
South Korean startup ONECOM has been honored for their groundbreaking smartphone Bluetooth QWERTY communicator, FINTIN V1, at CES 2024. The device won the prestigious “Best of Innovation” award in the Mobile Devices, Accessories & Apps category and was recognized as an Honoree in the Computer Peripherals & Accessories category.
What sets FINTIN V1 apart is its Structured Mini QWERTY technology, which modularizes 36 keys into just 6 keys. This innovation enables blind typing, allowing users to input keystrokes without needing to check the position of the keys visually. The compact size of the Mini QWERTY keyboard makes it easily manageable with one hand, further enhancing the user experience.
Visually impaired individuals often encounter difficulties in the era of touch interfaces that heavily rely on visual confirmation. On-screen keyboards do not provide accurate tactile feedback, making it challenging for blind users to input text. FINTIN V1 eliminates this barrier, significantly improving digital connectivity and social interaction for the visually impaired.
To ensure comprehensive accessibility, FINTIN V1 includes dedicated keys for screen readers like VoiceOver (iOS) and TalkBack (Android). The device also incorporates haptic feedback, enabling visually impaired users to navigate and access smartphone functions effortlessly without manual assistance.
ONECOM’s vision is to create a world where visually impaired individuals, numbering around 285 million globally, can independently interact and communicate with non-disabled individuals, work, learn, create content, and lead fulfilling lives.
The innovative Structured Mini QWERTY technology utilized in FINTIN V1 is not limited to products designed for the visually impaired. It has adaptable applications across various text input devices such as console game controllers, smart TV remote controllers, and controllers for Metaverse/XR headsets, providing a more inclusive and user-friendly experience across different platforms.
ONECOM’s award-winning products, recognized for their innovation, will be showcased at CES 2024 in Las Vegas. One of the highlights will be the FINTIN XPANDER, an ingenious solution designed to facilitate rapid text input across a wide range of gaming and smart devices.
With their revolutionary advancements, ONECOM is paving the way for greater accessibility and inclusivity in the digital world.
FAQ:
Q: What is the FINTIN V1?
A: The FINTIN V1 is a smartphone Bluetooth QWERTY communicator developed by South Korean startup ONECOM.
Q: What is the significance of the FINTIN V1 winning the “Best of Innovation” award?
A: The FINTIN V1 won the prestigious “Best of Innovation” award in the Mobile Devices, Accessories & Apps category at CES 2024, highlighting its groundbreaking features and design.
Q: What is the Structured Mini QWERTY technology?
A: The FINTIN V1 utilizes Structured Mini QWERTY technology, which modularizes 36 keys into just 6 keys. This technology enables blind typing, allowing users to input keystrokes without visually checking the position of the keys.
Q: How does the FINTIN V1 improve accessibility for visually impaired individuals?
A: The FINTIN V1 improves accessibility by providing accurate tactile feedback through its compact Mini QWERTY keyboard and incorporating dedicated keys for screen readers. It also includes haptic feedback, enabling visually impaired users to navigate and access smartphone functions effortlessly without manual assistance.
Q: Is the FINTIN V1 only designed for visually impaired individuals?
A: No, the Structured Mini QWERTY technology utilized in the FINTIN V1 has adaptable applications across various text input devices, such as console game controllers, smart TV remote controllers, and controllers for Metaverse/XR headsets.
Definitions:
1. Structured Mini QWERTY technology: A technology that modularizes a standard QWERTY keyboard into a more compact layout, typically with fewer keys. In the FINTIN V1, it modularizes 36 keys into 6 keys, enabling blind typing and making text input easier for visually impaired individuals.
2. Haptic feedback: A tactile feedback mechanism that provides vibrations or other physical sensations to the user, typically in response to touch or interaction with a device. In the context of the FINTIN V1, it helps visually impaired users navigate and access smartphone functions without visual confirmation.
